commit.message:
Update dependencies from https://github.com/nuget/nuget.client build 6.13.0.95

NuGet.Build.Tasks
 From Version 6.13.0-rc.93 -> To Version 6.13.0-rc.95

nodes.body: @JanKrivanek as a rule we shouldn't be taking these updates to release branches. Is this one special?

> @JanKrivanek as a rule we shouldn't be taking these updates to release branches. Is this one special?

My bad - I'm unaware of such rule. Can you please point me? 
Should then the subscriptions be created in disabled state for release branches? Or anything we can improve in the checklist https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild/blob/main/documentation/release-checklist.md#adjust-darc-channels-and-subscriptions?

Discussed with @YuliiaKovalova - it sounds like we only want the keep bumping SBRP and Arcade; otherwise Roslyn and Nuget (or any possible future product dependencies) should be bumped only if this is needed by SDK or VS. Is that correct?

This is suggested checklist update:

https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild/pull/11131/commits/5278e70906b62006132aa0c826b58200b2781499#diff-61ca3e227e41a59774153096623e36063335a5f1b801021995a92efcaf55ce80R61
